reviews.text: I read about this hotel in Fodor's and it was everything they said.
reviews.title: Charming and makes you feel welcome!

reviews.text: Next to the large cathedral in Glasgow and located in the merchant district, the building has lots of history and is easy to locate from the main freeway. Downtown is about a 10 minute walk.
reviews.title: Very Disapponinted
So Amazing
reviews.text: The hotel rooms were updated, the bathroom was clean and everything worked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm amused to see the range of reviews for this hotel. I would like to tell the world that I found the Cathedral House fantastic. I stayed there twice, with my husband, this October.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: I'll admit it's a bit of a trip. We got lost walking from the bus station the first time we stayed there, but by our second visit we had the walk down. It's about a 15 minute walk from the main square/Queen's Street train station.
reviews.title: horror

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once you get to the house, which is just gorgeous, you go into the bar and check in. The regular bar tender is such a trip! He didn't understand our American english and we couldn't understand his Scottish English, so we all had to talk very slowly and point. But he was a very sweet young man.
reviews.title: Mixed Bag

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The stair case is very windy and steep, but broad.
reviews.title: Mixed review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each time we stayed there we got a "Cathedral room," with a gorgeous view of the Cathedral laid out before us in several large windows.
reviews.title: Loved Cathedral House
